intro: Cissus robinsonii, commonly known as the climbing cissus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Convulvulaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit. The plant features heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. Cissus robinsonii is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of light conditions.
